Class Loop

java.lang.Object
  edu.luc.cs.trull.EmptyComponent
      edu.luc.cs.trull.TerminatingComponent
          edu.luc.cs.trull.AbstractComponent
              edu.luc.cs.trull.AbstractCombinator
                  edu.luc.cs.trull.SingleChildCombinator
                      edu.luc.cs.trull.Loop
All Implemented Interfaces:
Combinator, Component, java.util.EventListener, java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, PropertyChangeSource, SchedulerAware, Startable, Suspendable, Terminating
public class Loop
extends SingleChildCombinator

A combinator that provides looping. Each time the body component terminates, the loop repeats and the body component is started anew. The body of the loop is sequentially composed with itself infinitely many times. Therefore, a loop component never terminates. The only way to get out of a loop is by stopping it explicitly. This can be achieved by embedding it within a preemption combinator such as Control, Cycle, or Watching. 

 loop
   body

See Also:
Sequence, Control, Cycle, Watching
